data: May be performed by RNs in the Emergency Departments
Refer to Decision Support Tool: Emergency Management of Dehydration

Inclusion Criteria:
- Triaged as CTAS 2, 3, 4 or 5
- Age 6 months and older
- Caregiver able to understand instructions
- Mild to Moderate dehydration
- Mild abdominal pain only (1-4 out of 10)
- Soft abdomen
- Alert GCS 15
- Absence of bilious emesis, bloody stools or emesis

Exclusion Criteria: 
- Triaged as CTAS 1
- Clinical signs of severe dehydration
- Persistent moderate abdominal pain (4 / 10), distension and rigidity
- Bloody stools or emesis
- Bilious vomiting
- Altered LOC
- Chronic health conditions such as: GI history or surgeries, metabolic disorders, heart or renal disease, history or toxic ingestions or trauma
Based on CTAS score and PRN
Refer to Decision Support Tool for Oral Rehydration Therapy (ORT) orders
Notify Treating Provider that PED NIA ED Management of Dehydration has been initiated
